text: Richard Allan Baker (born March 18, 1940) was the first Historian of the United States Senate from 1975 until 2009. He directed the United States Senate Historical Office from the time of its creation in 1975. ==Other websites== * Saving Senate History , via pbs.org November 25, 2002 * Senate Historian Reflects on 34 Years of Unusual Queries, via New York Times August 8, 2009 * **C-SPAN Q&A; interview with Baker, June 12, 2005 **C-SPAN Q&A; interview with Baker, September 27, 2009 **C-SPAN "Q&A;" interview with Baker, July 7, 2013 * Senate Historical Office oral history interviews * Senate briefs Category:1940 births Category:Living people Category:Historians of the United States Senate Category:Writers from Massachusetts
